text:
"Your $shipOrFleet Has been Scanned and confirmed, wishing you the aviation lights never go out, comrade."The $personRank of Shackles Garrison gave you a standard military salute.
OR
"Wishing you a smooth sailing and always serving as your shield, comrade $playerName."The $personRank of Shackles Garrison gave you a standard military salute.
OR
"For the battle group! Comrade."The $personRank of Shackles Garrison gave you a standard military salute.
OR
"Comrade $playerName, all for the battle group, always ready to support your actions."The $personRank of Shackles Garrison gave you a standard military salute.
OR
"Comrade $personName."The $personRank of Shackles Garrison gave you a standard military salute.
OR
"Comrade, this is $personRank $personName, we will contribute to the battle group just like you."

"FOR The Shackles Garrison !!!"

The communication link was severed prior to your response.

Despite the opponent's ship being less powerful than your fleet, your scanner nonetheless detected the characteristic signal indicative of the opponent's weapon activation.
OR
"You disgusted rebel, the battle group will never forget my contribution! Absolutely not!"$personRank Shouting at you loudly, as you saw form the screen.

The communication link was severed prior to your response.

Despite the opponent's ship being less powerful than your fleet, your scanner nonetheless detected the characteristic signal indicative of the opponent's weapon activation.
OR
"...For the Shackles Garrison."

The communication link was severed prior to your response.

Despite the opponent's ship being less powerful than your fleet, your scanner nonetheless detected the characteristic signal indicative of the opponent's weapon activation.

"We will eliminate you, absolutely. " The other person gritted their teeth and said,

The communication link was severed prior to your response.
OR
The other fleet refused your communication.
OR
"Be prepared to pay the price, disobedient. "

The communication link was cut off after this word.
OR
"Violators have only one fate. "

The communication link was cut off before you responded.

Your scanner has detected the characteristic signal of the opponent's weapon activation.

Your communication request has been rejected.
OR
"Those who defy the Chain Garrison Army have only one fate. "

OR
"Violators have only one fate. "

The communication link was cut off before you responded.
OR
Your communication request has been ignored, and the other fleet is gradually approaching you.

At this point, your scanner detected a large number of characteristic signals from the opponent's weapons simultaneously activated.
OR
You attempted to establish a communication connection with the other fleet, but did not receive a response.
OR
"$playerName, We can do this the easy way or the hard way, but... It's your choice."

The communication link was cut off before you responded.
OR
The other fleet ignored your communication request, and your scanner detected a large number of characteristic signals from the other party's weapons simultaneously activated.
OR
"Ready to die, since we won't take prisoners. "

The communication link was cut off before you responded.
OR
After a brief wait, your connection request was accepted.

"Turn on the transponder, unauthorized deactivation of the transponder is not allowed in Shackles Garrison's jurisdiction."

At this point, your scanner detected a large number of characteristic signals from the opponent's weapons simultaneously activated.
OR
"Now! Open the responder immediately! Or we have the right to choose another way to eliminate potential threats."

At this point, your scanner detected a large number of characteristic signals from the opponent's weapons simultaneously activated.
OR

At this point, your scanner detected a large number of characteristic signals from the opponent's weapons simultaneously activated.
options:
turnOnTransponder:Turn your transponder on
cutCommLink:Cut the comm link

OR

text:
"Your identities have been scanned and identified. If there is no doubt, we will not spending more time into this. $personRank Out."

The communication link was cut off before you responded.
OR
This $personRank looks a bit impatient. "Is there any urgent situation that needs to be reported? " "No? Then let's continue on the road. Out. "

The communication link was cut off before you responded.
OR
"Your $shipOrFleet has been scanned and identified, everything is normal. Wishing you a smooth sailing and completion. Out."

The communication link was cut off before you responded.
OR
"Your identities have been scanned, please keep your distance. Out."

The communication link was cut off before you responded.

"You can't just hang around with this thing outside! If you come across any, please hand it over to us, and we will take care of it carefully."
OR
"AI core? This is a very dangerous thing, and I hope you can hand it over to us for your consideration."

"Outstanding decision, comrade $playerName. The group will not forget your contribution。" $personRank of Shackles Garrison gave you a standard military salute.

Before you left, $personRank stopped you, and then said, "Comrade, you have chosen the right path. "
OR
"Outstanding decision, comrade $playerName. The group will not forget your contribution。" $personRank of Shackles Garrison gave you a standard military salute.

Before you left, $personRank stopped you, and then said, "$playerName comrade, you have omy respect."
OR
"Outstanding decision, comrade $playerName. The group will not forget your contribution。" $personRank of Shackles Garrison gave you a standard military salute.

Before you left, $personRank stopped you, and then said, "$playerName comrade, this is exactly what sets us apart from those scattered pieces of Tri-Tachyon hyenas."
OR
"Outstanding decision, comrade $playerName. The group will not forget your contribution。" $personRank of Shackles Garrison gave you a standard military salute.

Before you left, $personRank stopped you, and then said, "Comrade $playerName, thank you for your contributions to the Chain Garrison Group Army. I deeply admire you."
Most officers of $theFaction will treat you as a nobody, and you won't receive any special treatment, but that's not necessarily a bad thing.
Some officers from $theFaction have heard of you and will give you more than a passing glance, but they still won't cut you any slack - just... maybe.

Your contributions to $theFaction have been recognized by some high-ranking officials. Often, you will receive extra attention from the group, and many have already begun to consider you as one of them.
You have been given numerous documents by $theFaction, and almost everyone will address you as "comrade." Seems you are already become a part of them.

You have now appeared on the propaganda posters of the $faction. You have become an important figure who is fully trusted by the group.

Thank you for your efforts, comrade.

Some customs and patrol teams have already expressed dissatisfaction with you, and you can clearly sense that their indifference towards you has been further compounded by a strong sense of mistrust, although no one has taken any action against you yet.
If you seize the opportunity to do something, $Faction might consider you not as someone who likes to stir up trouble.

Your movement analysis report has been synchronized to all patrol teams, intercepting you has become a priority event. If it weren't for your informants secretly handling some more troublesome eyewitness reports, you might have already been branded as untrustworthy. Currently, the official port of $Faction is required to ban trade with you, and you need to think of other ways to sneak in.

For $Faction, the only fate for an enemy is death. All fleets can engage you in battle without question, and all their official markets are prohibited from trading with you. Your informants have been struggling to handle these issues. Additionally, $Faction has completely severed ties with you, making it extremely difficult to change this situation now; convincing them to change their attitude towards you is practically impossible.

You are a public enemy of $theFaction, and you have appeared on the group's promotional posters. Writing your death report in person has become a target for many officers and civilians. For $Faction, your presence is a huge obstacle on its path to revival, in other words: they are always ready to cause trouble for you. To make matters worse, you have lost contact with your eyeliner, and now you must prepare for the worst.

Unlike most local taverns, this one is more like a legal drunk zone, where people of all kinds indulge in it - including high-ranking officials of the chain defense.

The rows of buildings on the side are also taverns, or even more shocking legal drug trading venues.Several of your bodyguards were almost dragged into the red-light district by the ladies who were trying to cheat them - not just once, but many more people who thoughtlessly fell into the embrace of debauchery.As you might expect, addiction is the main theme here, and it's no wonder that the Lud Church has issued a formal condemnation of Chain Guard.

People are drunk and celebrating, and you do not know when will this scene having an end.

script:
AddText "The surface doesn't look as militarized as one might expect; rather, the opposite. While the environment here is not top-notch, if you are willing to head to the central area, you will discover a plethora of flashy markets, massive commercial districts, and clubs that cater to entertainment until death. This place has what most places have, just more concentrated." marketFlavorTextColor
AddText "You entered a special reception area - this is a window specifically prepared for foreign captains. The staff did not hand you the familiar Tri-Pad, but a list." marketFlavorTextColor
AddText "Above there are items that can be traded." marketFlavorTextColor

AddText "You're glad you took the executive officer's advice and wore your hard suit onto the shuttle." marketFlavorTextColor
AddText "The entire plant is under complete militarized management, with only countless industrial military facilities that obscure the sky in sight - pollution on the planet even cannot simply spread with the heavy storm - all emissions are blocked by those buildings; the toxic fumes that can kill instantly plummet straight from the chimneys into the crowds, including you, and then penetrate deep into the planet's core through a dense network of walkways." marketFlavorTextColor
AddText "You have been thoroughly questioned several times by fully armed patrol teams, and fortunately, a relatively friendly official came to your rescue. Otherwise, you would have been directly taken away by certain skeleton shoulder badge groups in black attire." marketFlavorTextColor
AddText "<I know you're not a dissenter, but you should go to the visitor's area instead of wandering around. I'll show you where you need to go.>" marketFlavorTextColor
AddText "So, just as you later told your deputy, it was at that moment you finally figured out where the damn visitor area was amidst those identical buildings." marketFlavorTextColor

AddText "Your shuttle made a great effort to fly down from the orbit, swaying - any spaceships without identifiers would be shot down directly, and you are sure that the patrol team that just failed to shoot you down is trying to blockade this area, no matter what you want to do." marketFlavorTextColor
AddText "You'd better hurry up." marketFlavorTextColor
